intro: Oreocharis eriocarpa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring cool and moist environments. Oreocharis eriocarpa is often found in forested areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
